ws
Class WumpusWorld

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--ws.WumpusWorld
All Implemented Interfaces:
Constants, java.io.Serializable
public class WumpusWorld
extends java.lang.Object
implements Constants, java.io.Serializable

The world of wumpus, a monster that lives in a rectangular cave, with several rooms. Some rooms contains a pit in which any explorer that enters will fall to death. In a single room there is a big treasure: a bar of gold that attracts several explorers into the dangers of the cave.

See Also:

Field Detail

agents

private java.util.Map agents
The agents that are in this world. It's actually a mapping from the agents to their positions in the world.

height

private int height
The height of this cave.

rooms

private Room[][] rooms
The rooms that make up this cave. The left-lower room is considered to be numbered (0,0).

width

private int width
The width of this cave.
Constructor Detail

WumpusWorld

public WumpusWorld(int width,
                   int height)
Creates a new wumpus world, given its dimension.
Parameters:
width - the number of room columns.
height - the number of room rows.

WumpusWorld

public WumpusWorld(int width,
                   int height,
                   double pitProbability)
Creates a new wumpus world, given its dimension and the probability of the occurrence of a pit in each room.
Parameters:
width - the number of room columns.
height - the number of room rows.
pitProbability - the probability (between 0 and 1) of the occurrence of a pit in each room.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the pit probability is so high that there's no space left for the gold.
Method Detail

addAgent

public void addAgent(Agent agent)
Adds an agent to this world. An agent can be an explorer or a wumpus.
Parameters:
agent - the agent to be inserted into this world.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the agent can't be added to the world, due to the restriction mentioned in the methods addExplorer and addWumpus, or because it's position lies outside the boundaries of this world.
See Also:
addExplorer(ws.Explorer), addWumpus(ws.Wumpus)

addExplorer

public void addExplorer(Explorer explorer)
Adds an explorer to this world. An explorer can only be added to an empty room, unless the room has only other explorers (i.e., no pits or wumpuses).
Parameters:
explorer - the explorer to be inserted into this world.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the explorer can't be added to the world, due to the restriction mentioned above, or because it's position lies outside the boundaries of this world.

addWumpus

public void addWumpus(Wumpus wumpus)
Adds a wumpus to this world. A wumpus can only be added to an empty room (i.e., no pits, explorers or other wumpuses).
Parameters:
wumpus - the wumpus to be inserted into this world.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the wumpus can't be added to the world, due to the restriction mentioned above, or because it's position lies outside the boundaries of this world.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given agent is already in this cave.

checkWalk

private void checkWalk(Agent a)
                throws BumpException
Checks whether an agent can walk.
Parameters:
a - the agent.
Throws:
BumpException - if the agent can't walk (because there is a wall in front of it).
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given agent doesn't belong to this world.

createAgent

public Agent createAgent(java.lang.String name,
                         int kind)
                  throws NoSpaceException
Creates a new agent to be inserted into this world. It's guaranteed that the agent will be safe at least in the first round. The wumpuses will be randomly placed in the world; the explorers, as of this version, will always start at room [0,0], facing right, if it's safe.
Parameters:
name - the agent's name
kind - the agent's kind. See the constants defined in Constants.java to obtain a list of possible values.
Throws:
NoSpaceException - when there's no safe room where the agent can be created.
See Also:
Constants.EXPLORER, Constants.WUMPUS

fromXml

public static WumpusWorld fromXml(java.lang.String xml)
Auxiliary method used to create an instance of a Wumpus World from a XML string.
Parameters:
xml - the XML string representing a Wumpus World
Returns:
the WumpusWorld represented by the given XML string.

getHeight

public int getHeight()
Returns the height of this cave.
Returns:
the height of this cave.

getPerceptions

public Perceptions getPerceptions(int row,
                                  int col,
                                  boolean bump,
                                  boolean wumpusScream,
                                  boolean explorerScream)
Return a set of perceptions that would be sent to an agent if it was in the given room.
Parameters:
row - the row of the room.
col - the column of the room.
bump - if the agent has hit something it can't trespass.
wumpusScream - if there is a wumpus scream in the world.
explorerScream - if there is an explorer scream in the world.
Returns:
the set of perceptions for that room.

getRoom

public Room getRoom(int row,
                    int col)
Returns a room from this world.
Parameters:
row - the row number
col - the column number
Returns:
the room located in [row,col].

Returns the width of this cave.

the width of this cave.

grab

public void grab(Explorer explorer)
          throws NoGoldException
Makes an explorer grab the gold that is in the same room as him.
Parameters:
explorer - the explorer to grab the gold.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given agent doesn't belong to this world.
NoGoldException - if there is no gold in the room of the agent.

           throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

Parameters:

Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given agent doesn't belong to this world.

shoot

public Agent shoot(Explorer explorer)
            throws NoArrowException
Makes an explorer shoots his arrow, assuming that the arrow reaches as far as the cave goes (or it hits an agent, killing it).
Parameters:
explorer - the explorer to shoot the arrow.
Returns:
the agent hit by the arrow, or null if none was hit.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given agent doesn't belong to this world.
NoArrowException - if the explorer doesn't have an arrow to shoot.

shoot

public Agent shoot(Explorer explorer,
                   int arrowReach)
            throws NoArrowException
Makes an explorer shoots his arrow.
Parameters:
explorer - the explorer to shoot the arrow.
arrowReach - the number of rooms the arrow can travel, before losing its speed and falling down.
Returns:
the agent hit by the arrow, or null if none was hit.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given agent doesn't belong to this world.
NoArrowException - if the explorer doesn't have an arrow to shoot.

          throws BumpException

walkWumpus

public void walkWumpus(Wumpus wumpus)
                throws BumpException
Makes a wumpus walk.
Parameters:
wumpus - the wumpus to walk.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given wumpus doesn't belong to this world.
BumpException - if the wumpus hits a wall or a room with another wumpus (they're too big to fit).
